Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Mediaeval \Me`di*[ae]"val\ (m[=e]`d[i^]*[=e]"val; 277), a. [L. medius middle + aevum age. See {Middle}, and {Age}.] Of or relating to the Middle Ages; as, medi[ae]val architecture. [Written also {medieval}.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Medieval \Me`di*e"val\, Medievalism \Me`di*e"val*ism\, Medievalist \Me`di*e"val*ist\ . Same as {Medi[ae]val}, {Medi[ae]valism}, etc. [1913 Webster]

medieval adj 1: relating to or belonging to the Middle Ages; "Medieval scholars"; "Medieval times" [syn: {mediaeval}] 2: as if belonging to the Middle Ages; old-fashioned and unenlightened; "a medieval attitude toward dating" [syn: {mediaeval}, {gothic}] 3: characteristic of the time of chivalry and knighthood in the Middle Ages; "chivalric rites"; "the knightly years" [syn: {chivalric}, {knightly}]
